intro: Silene flos-cuculi subsp. flos-cuculi, commonly known as the nightshade catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces striking pink or red flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it prefers well-drained soils in sunny to partially shaded habitats. The species is part of the Caryophyllaceae family, known for its showy flowers and often succulent stems.
